title: [$250] Refactor provided component to use useSearchSelector hook and remove unused and duplicated code (Task 7)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developersâ€™ and users' experience, weâ€™ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. These components serve: 1. options selection 2. options sorting 3. options filtering 4. phone contacts importing Using that hook will make the user experience more consistent across all components. #### Task 7 ``` ðŸ’¡ This one should be done with extra care as there is more advanced logic inside the component ``` Refactor provided component to use `useSearchSelector` hook and remove unused and duplicated code. Components: 1. `MoneyRequestAttendeeSelector` Important notes: 1. you can use `InviteReportParticipantsPage` as an example of the implementation 2. you should create new const value to use as `context` param: `CONST.SEARCH_SELECTOR.SEARCH_CONTEXT_ATTENDEES` 3. you need to ensure all functionalities are working correctly. Especially: selection, filtering, ordering, and inviting new users 4. After refactoring, we can remove `getAttendees` cc/ @mountiny @sosek108

Launch Expensify app. 2. Open 1:1 DM. 3. Submit two expenses to the user. 4. Go to Reports > Menu > Reports. 5. Expand the report. 6. Long tap on the expense report > Select. 7. Select one of the expenses. 8. Tap dropdown button > Hold. 9. Enter reason and save it. â†’ Selection mode persists after holding expense on Reports. 10. Change the search query to group-by:from and search. 11. Expand the user row. 12. Long tap on the expense report > Select. 13. Select the unheld expense. 14. Tap dropdown button > Hold. 15. Enter reason and save it. ## Expected Result: After holding expense when search result is group-by:from, the selection mode will persist. ## Actual Result: After holding expense when search result is group-by:from, the selection mode exits, which is different from when the search result is group-by:report (Step 9). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/69be6dba-e11e-4e86-8eb7-12de89488e0d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Removal of deprecated gestureHandlerRootHOC

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem: We are currently using `gestureHandlerRootHOC` in ValidateCodeForm, which was added there to resolve the issue of the number fields on the new contact method not being clickable on Android. The issue is that `gestureHandlerRootHOC` has been deprecated for two months and will be removed in the future version of Gesture Handler. ### Solution: Let's move away from it and use the suggested GestureHandlerRootView instead. Lets make sure the issue that was a reason to introduce this remains fixed https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/51293#issuecomment-2469664545

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.16-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 18.5 Safari **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new gmail account with + 2. Create a workspace, verify that the workspace tasks appear in the Concierge chat 3. Delete the workspace 4. Navigate to the Concierge chat 5. Click on the links in the tasks like "Review your workspace settings" or "Create a workspace" - "Not here" page shown 6. Create a new workspace and repeat step 5 ## Expected Result: The workspace tasks are removed from the Concierge chat after deleting the workspace. Like when you sign in with a gmail account without +, the workspace tasks are deleted along with the #admins after deleting the workspace, and do not reappear after creating a new workspace. ## Actual Result: The workspace tasks are still present in the Concierge chat after deleting the workspace, the links lead to "Not here" page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5e37bf47-69ab-41fc-be46-f605ab9ff0bf [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
